metadata.title: ISO/IEC 27001:2022 - Information Security Management Systems
metadata.remarks: ISO/IEC 27001 is the international gold standard for establishing, implementing, maintaining, and continually improving an Information Security Management System (ISMS). It requires a systemic approach to managing sensitive company information through continuous risk assessment and risk treatment. The 2022 revision consolidated 114 controls into 93 across 4 domains.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information security policy and topic-specific policies shall be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Create a master information security policy with topic-specific sub-policies. Store in Git for version control. Require annual review and employee acknowledgment.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Information security policy; Sub-policy library; Acknowledgment records; Review dates

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information security roles and responsibilities shall be defined and allocated.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define RACI matrix for security responsibilities. Appoint CISO or equivalent. Document roles in job descriptions.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: RACI matrix; Role descriptions; Org chart

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility shall be segregated.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Identify conflicting duties (e.g., developer vs deployer). Implement separation in CI/CD pipelines. Document segregation matrix.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Segregation matrix; CI/CD access controls; Role conflict analysis

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Subscribe to threat intelligence feeds. Monitor CVE databases. Integrate threat intel into risk assessment process.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Threat intelligence subscriptions; Threat analysis reports; CVE monitoring configurations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information security shall be integrated into project management.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Include security review gates in project lifecycle. Require threat modeling for new features. Add security acceptance criteria to user stories.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Security review gate documentation; Threat model artifacts; Security-related user stories

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information shall be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define classification levels (Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted). Apply labels to data stores and documents.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Classification policy; Data inventory with classifications; Labeling evidence

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement RBAC. Enforce least privilege. Conduct quarterly access reviews. Use SSO where feasible.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Access control policy; RBAC configurations; Access review reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Processes and procedures shall be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Maintain vendor inventory. Assess vendor security posture. Include security requirements in contracts. Review vendor risk annually.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Vendor inventory; Vendor assessments; Contract security clauses

controls.title: Information Security Incident Management Planning and Preparation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The organization shall plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Develop incident response plan with clear roles. Define severity levels. Establish communication protocols. Test annually.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Incident response plan; Contact lists; Severity matrix; Tabletop exercise reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The organization shall plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Include information security in business continuity plans. Define security procedures for crisis situations. Test failover security.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: BCP with security provisions; Crisis security procedures; Failover test results

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel shall be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Conduct background checks for all new hires. Implement ongoing screening for sensitive roles.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Background check policy; Screening records; Third-party screening vendor contract

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Employment contractual agreements shall state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Include security obligations in employment contracts. Define NDA requirements. Specify acceptable use terms.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Employment contract templates; NDA templates; Signed agreements

controls.title: Information Security Awareness, Education and Training

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties shall receive appropriate information security awareness education and training.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement annual security awareness training. Conduct phishing simulations. Provide role-specific training for developers and admins.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Training program; Completion records; Phishing simulation results

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: A disciplinary process shall be formalized and communicated to take actions against personnel who have committed an information security policy violation.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define graduated disciplinary process for security violations. Document and communicate consequences.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Disciplinary policy; Violation tracking records

controls.title: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, enforced and communicated.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define offboarding procedures. Revoke access immediately on termination. Enforce post-employment obligations.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Offboarding checklist; Access revocation logs; Post-employment agreement

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The organization shall provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Provide clear reporting channels (email, ticketing, hotline). Train staff on what constitutes a security event. Mandate timely reporting.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Reporting channel documentation; Incident report samples; Training materials

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define physical security zones. Implement badge access. Deploy surveillance cameras. Maintain visitor logs.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Physical security policy; Access control configurations; Surveillance footage samples; Visitor logs

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Premises shall be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Install CCTV systems. Implement intrusion detection sensors. Monitor 24/7. Retain footage per policy.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: CCTV configurations; Monitoring procedures; Retention policy

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Storage media shall be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Track all storage media. Implement secure disposal procedures. Encrypt portable media. Log media movements.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Media inventory; Disposal certificates; Encryption configurations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices shall be protected.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Deploy MDM/endpoint protection. Enforce full-disk encryption. Require screen lock. Push OS and application updates.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: MDM deployment status; Encryption verification; Patch compliance reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The allocation and use of privileged access rights shall be restricted and managed.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement PAM (Privileged Access Management). Use just-in-time admin access. Log all privileged operations. Review quarterly.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: PAM configurations; Privileged access logs; Quarterly review reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Access to information and other associated assets shall be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement data-level access controls. Restrict API endpoints by role. Enforce need-to-know access to databases.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Access control configurations; API authorization rules; Database permission sets

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Secure authentication technologies and procedures shall be established and implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Enforce MFA for all systems. Use strong password policies. Implement SSO. Prohibit default credentials.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: MFA enrollment reports; Password policy configuration; SSO configurations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Protection against malware shall be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Deploy EDR/antimalware on all endpoints. Enable real-time scanning. Update signatures automatically. Alert on detections.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: EDR deployment status; Update configuration; Detection alert samples

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities shall be evaluated and appropriate measures shall be taken.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Conduct regular vulnerability scans. Prioritize by CVSS score. Remediate critical/high within SLA. Track in ticketing system.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Vulnerability scan reports; Remediation SLA policy; Patching records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks shall be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Define secure baselines using CIS benchmarks. Implement configuration management (Ansible, Terraform). Monitor for config drift.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Baseline configurations; IaC templates; Drift detection reports

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Data masking shall be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement dynamic data masking for non-production environments. Mask PII in logs. Use tokenization for sensitive data.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Data masking configurations; Non-production data policies; Log redaction evidence

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events shall be produced, stored, protected and analysed.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement centralized logging (ELK, Splunk, CloudWatch). Log authentication events, access changes, and admin actions. Protect log integrity.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Logging architecture; Log retention policy; Log integrity controls; Sample log queries

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Networks and network devices shall be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Implement network segmentation. Deploy firewalls and WAFs. Monitor network traffic. Restrict management access.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Network architecture diagram; Firewall rules; WAF configurations; Network monitoring tools

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, shall be defined and implemented.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Enforce AES-256 for data at rest. Require TLS 1.2+ for data in transit. Implement key management procedures. Rotate keys per policy.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Cryptography policy; Encryption configurations; Key management procedures; Certificate inventory

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Rules for the secure development of software and systems shall be established and applied.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Integrate SAST/DAST into CI/CD pipelines. Require peer code review. Conduct threat modeling. Train developers on secure coding.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: SDLC security policy; CI/CD pipeline configurations; SAST/DAST scan results; Code review records

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Secure coding principles shall be applied to software development.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose: Follow OWASP guidelines. Implement input validation, output encoding, parameterized queries. Use security linters.

parts.name: evidence
parts.prose: Secure coding standards; Linter configurations; Developer training records
